intro: Euphorbia orobanchoides var. calycina, commonly known as the California broom. This plant is a succulent shrub native to California, characterized by its fleshy, branching stems and small, scale-like leaves. It produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters, which are typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and xeriscaping. It is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
